document_title: Stye: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
A stye that has just begun to develop is often difficult to recognize with the naked eye because there are no signs of inflammation [3]. If you suspect you have a stye, you should see an Ophthalmologist for timely examination and treatment. The doctor will prescribe the following diagnoses:
Medical history: to determine symptoms and health problems contributing to the stye; Examine the outside of the eye: including eyelid structure, skin texture, shape and eyelashes; Evaluate the eyelid border: eyelashes, oil gland holes using a specialized eye examination machine.
subsection_title: leo mat.json. Method of diagnosing styes
subsection_data:
leo mat.json. Method of diagnosing styes
A stye that has just begun to develop is often difficult to recognize with the naked eye because there are no signs of inflammation [3]. If you suspect you have a stye, you should see an Ophthalmologist for timely examination and treatment. The doctor will prescribe the following diagnoses:
Medical history: to determine symptoms and health problems contributing to the stye; Examine the outside of the eye: including eyelid structure, skin texture, shape and eyelashes; Evaluate the eyelid border: eyelashes, oil gland holes using a specialized eye examination machine.
